title:
Deterministic Equivalent of the Log-Euclidean Distance between Sample
  Covariance Matrices
abstract:
Log-Euclidean distances are commonly used to quantify the similarity between
positive definite matrices using geometric considerations. This paper analyzes
the behavior of this distance when it is used to measure closeness between
independent sample covariance matrices. A closed form expression is given for
the deterministic equivalent of such distance, which asymptotically
approximates the actual distance in the large observation regime (both sample
size and observation dimension grow to infinity at the same rate). The
deterministic equivalent can be used to analyze the performance of the
log-Euclidean metric when compared to other commonly used metrics such as the
Euclidean norm or the symmetrized Kullback-Leibler divergence.
subjects: Electrical Engineering and Systems Science/Signal Processing
